metadata.title: CVE-2021-47455 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ptp:Fix possible memory leak in ptp_clock_register() I got memory leak asfollows when doing fault injection test: unreferenced object0xffff88800906c618 (size 8): comm "i2c-idt82p33931", pid 4421, jiffies4294948083 (age 13.188s) hex dump (first 8 bytes): 70 74 70 30 00 00 00 00ptp0.... backtrace: [<00000000312ed458>] __kmalloc_track_caller+0x19f/0x3a0[<0000000079f6e2ff>] kvasprintf+0xb5/0x150 [<0000000026aae54f>]kvasprintf_const+0x60/0x190 [<00000000f323a5f7>]kobject_set_name_vargs+0x56/0x150 [<000000004e35abdd>]dev_set_name+0xc0/0x100 [<00000000f20cfe25>] ptp_clock_register+0x9f4/0xd30[ptp] [<000000008bb9f0de>] idt82p33_probe.cold+0x8b6/0x1561 [ptp_idt82p33]When posix_clock_register() returns an error, the name allocated indev_set_name() will be leaked, the put_device() should be used to give upthe device reference, then the name will be freed in kobject_cleanup() andother memory will be freed in ptp_clock_release().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
